original_text: director douglas mcgrath takes on nickleby with all the halfhearted zeal of an 8th grade boy delving into required reading .
generated_text:
1. "Director Baz Luhrmann tackles Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet with the same level of enthusiasm as a college student reluctantly reading a required textbook."
2. "Peter Jackson's adaptation of The Lord of the Rings is handled with the same level of dedication as a high school student forced to write a book report."
3. "Francis Ford Coppola's Apocalypse Now is directed with the same level of passion as a graduate student writing a thesis on a topic they don't really care about."
4. "Steven Spielberg's Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade is made with the same level of excitement as a kid reluctantly doing their homework."
